briefdescription.para: Parameters for the insolidangle selection method.

memberdef.name: help_insolidangle
memberdef.initializer:
= { "::", "", " insolidangle center POS span POS_EXPR [cutoff REAL]", "", "This keyword selects atoms that are within [TT]REAL[tt] degrees", "(default=5) of any position in [TT]POS_EXPR[tt] as seen from [TT]POS[tt]", "a position expression that evaluates to a single position), i.e., atoms", "in the solid angle spanned by the positions in [TT]POS_EXPR[tt] and", "centered at [TT]POS[tt].[PAR]"
"Technically, the solid angle is constructed as a union of small cones", "whose tip is at [TT]POS[tt] and the axis goes through a point in", "[TT]POS_EXPR[tt]. There is such a cone for each position in", "[TT]POS_EXPR[tt], and point is in the solid angle if it lies within any", "of these cones. The cutoff determines the width of the cones.", }

briefdescription.para: Help text for the insolidangle selection method.

memberdef.name: sm_insolidangle
memberdef.initializer: = { "insolidangle", GROUP_VALUE, 2 , ((int)(sizeof( smparams_insolidangle )/sizeof(( smparams_insolidangle )[0]))), smparams_insolidangle, &init_data_insolidangle, NULL, &init_insolidangle, NULL, &free_data_insolidangle, &init_frame_insolidangle, NULL, &evaluate_insolidangle, {"insolidangle center POS span POS_EXPR [cutoff REAL]", "Selecting atoms in a solid angle", ((int)(sizeof( help_insolidangle )/sizeof(( help_insolidangle )[0]))), help_insolidangle}, }

briefdescription.para: Selection method data for the insolidangle method.
Allocates data for the insolidangle selection method.

detaileddescription.para:
npar
Not used (should be 3).
param
Method parameters (should point to smparams_insolidangle).
Pointer to the allocated data (t_methoddata_insolidangle). Allocates memory for a t_methoddata_insolidangle structure and initializes the parameter as follows:
center defines the value for t_methoddata_insolidangle::center.
span defines the value for t_methoddata_insolidangle::span.
cutoff defines the value for t_methoddata_insolidangle::angcut.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the insolidangle selection method.

detaileddescription.para:
top
Not used.
npar
Not used.
param
Not used.
data
Pointer to t_methoddata_insolidangle to initialize.
0 on success, -1 on failure. Converts t_methoddata_insolidangle::angcut to radians and allocates and allocates memory for the bins used during the evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Frees the data allocated for the insolidangle selection method.

detaileddescription.para:
data
Data to free (should point to a t_methoddata_insolidangle).
Frees the memory allocated for t_methoddata_insolidangle::center and t_methoddata_insolidangle::span, as well as the memory for the internal bin structure.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the evaluation of the insolidangle selection method for a frame.

detaileddescription.para:
top
Not used.
fr
Not used.
pbc
PBC structure.
data
Should point to a t_methoddata_insolidangle.
Creates a lookup structure that enables fast queries of whether a point is within the solid angle or not.

briefdescription.para: Internal helper function for evaluate_insolidangle().

parameterdescription.para: Test point.
PBC data (if NULL, no PBC are used).
Pointer to a t_methoddata_insolidangle data structure.

simplesect.para: true if x is within the solid angle, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the insolidangle selection method.

detaileddescription.para: See sel_updatefunc() for description of the parameters. data should point to a t_methoddata_insolidangle.
Calculates which atoms in g are within the solid angle spanned by t_methoddata_insolidangle::span and centered at t_methoddata_insolidangle::center, and stores the result in out->u.g.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the distance between unit vectors.

detaileddescription.para:
x1
Unit vector 1.
x2
Unit vector 2.
Minus the dot product of x1 and x2. This function is used internally to calculate the distance between the unit vectors x1 and x2 to find out whether x2 is within the cone centered at x1. Currently, the cosine of the angle is used for efficiency, and the minus is there to make it behave like a normal distance (larger values mean longer distances).

briefdescription.para: Does a binary search on a t_partition to find a bin for a value.

detaileddescription.para:
p
Partition to search.
value
Value to search for.
The partition index in p that contains value. If value is outside the range of p, the first/last index is returned. Otherwise, the return value i satisfies p->p[i].left<=value and p->p[i+1].left>value

briefdescription.para: Finds a bin that corresponds to a location on the unit sphere surface.

detaileddescription.para:
surf
Surface data structure to search.
x
Unit vector to find.
The bin index that contains x. The return value is an index to the surf->bin array.

briefdescription.para: Clears/initializes the bins on the unit sphere surface.

detaileddescription.para:
surf
Surface data structure.
Clears the reference points from the bins and (re)initializes the edges of the azimuthal bins.

briefdescription.para: Frees memory allocated for storing the reference points in the surface bins.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (t_methoddata_insolidangle *surf, int tbin, int pbin, rvec x)
memberdef.name: add_surface_point

briefdescription.para: Adds a reference point to a given bin.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure.
Bin number in the zenith angle direction.
Bin number in the azimuthal angle direction.
Point to store.

briefdescription.para: Marks a bin as completely covered.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure.
Bin number in the zenith angle direction.
Bin number in the azimuthal angle direction.

memberdef.argsstring: (t_methoddata_insolidangle *surf, int tbin, real phi, real pdelta1, real pdelta2, real pdeltamax, rvec x)
memberdef.name: update_surface_bin

briefdescription.para: Helper function for store_surface_point() to update a single zenith angle bin.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure.
Bin number in the zenith angle direction.
Azimuthal angle of x.
Width of the cone at the lower edge of tbin.
Width of the cone at the uppper edge of tbin.
Max. width of the cone inside tbin.
Point to store (should have unit length).

briefdescription.para: Adds a single reference point and updates the surface bins.

detaileddescription.para:
surf
Surface data structure.
x
Point to store (should have unit length).
Finds all the bins covered by the cone centered at x and calls update_surface_bin() to update them.

briefdescription.para: Optimizes the surface bins for faster searching.

detaileddescription.para:
surf
Surface data structure.
Currently, this function does nothing.

briefdescription.para: Estimates the area covered by the reference cones.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure.

simplesect.para: An estimate for the area covered by the reference points.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a point lies within a solid angle.

parameterdescription.para: Surface data structure to search.
Unit vector to check.

simplesect.para: true if x is within the solid angle, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the covered fraction of the selection can be calculated.

parameterdescription.para: Selection element to query.

simplesect.para: true if the covered fraction can be estimated for sel with _gmx_selelem_estimate_coverfrac(), false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the covered fraction of the selection for the current frame.

detaileddescription.para:
sel
Selection for which the fraction should be calculated.
Fraction of angles covered by the selection (between zero and one). The return value is undefined if _gmx_selelem_can_estimate_cover() returns false. Should be called after gmx_ana_evaluate_selections() has been called for the frame.

briefdescription.para: Implements the insolidangle selection method.

xrefdescription.para: The implementation could be optimized quite a bit.
Move the covered fraction stuff somewhere else and make it more generic (along the lines it is handled in selection.h and trajana.h in the old C API).
